description:
The sample begins with an online Feature Service displayed on the map. Clicking the Generate button will download a local geodatabase from the service. Once a geodatabase has been generated from the feature service, the local geodatabase will be displayed on the map. This is achieved by using a single FeatureLayer in the map, and switching the source feature table between the GeodatabaseFeatureServiceTable (the online feature service) and the GeodatabaseFeatureTable (the offline geodatabase). Once the the local geodatabase is downloaded and displayed on the map, you can select any feature by tapping or clicking the symbol, and you can then move it anywhere on the mapview by clicking in another location. For the changes to take effect on the feature service, you must click on the Sync Button. After the sync is performed you can toggle between online and offline mode using the switch. However, in this sample, edits can only be made in offline mode.



Resourse level: üçåüçåüçå
name: 1faf7d34c36443efa0a25c62a2471695.zip
snippet: This sample shows how the QML API can be used to edit features within an offline geodatabase and sync back to the service.
title: Local Geodatabase Editing
